text.p: The Department of Fire and Emergency Services advises that people should:
If outside find safe shelter away from trees, power lines, storm water drains and streams.
Close your curtains and blinds, and stay inside away from windows.
Unplug electrical appliances and do not use land line telephones if there is lightning.
If there is flooding, create your own sandbags by using pillow cases filled with sand and place them around doorways to protect your home.
If boating, swimming or surfing leave the water.
Do not drive into water of unknown depth and current.
Slow down and turn your headlights on.
Be alert and watch for hazards on the road such as fallen power lines and loose debris.
If it is raining heavily and you can not see, pull over and park with your hazard lights on until the rain clears.

warning-info.text: The next warning will be issued by 11:15 pm WST Saturday.

text.p: This warning is also available through TV and Radio broadcasts, the Bureau's web site at www.bom.gov.au or call 1300 659 213.
The Bureau and Department of Fire and Emergency Services would appreciate this warning being broadcast regularly.

forecast-period.text: People in the Interior of WA in the vicinity of Giles.

text.p: People are advised that there is a risk of SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS in eastern parts of the Interior of WA in the vicinity of Giles. Thunderstorm activity should ease later this evening.
At 8:00pm satellite imagery showed an area of thunderstorms with potentially heavy rainfall and damaging winds moving eastwards through the Giles area.
Storms may be accompanied by
-HEAVY RAINFALL which may lead to FLASH FLOODING.
Storms could cause DAMAGE TO HOMES AND PROPERTY.
Giles has recorded 32mm in the 30 minutes since 7:38pm.
Giles recorded a wind gust to 88 kilometres per hour at 7:57pm.
The overall weather pattern is not unusual for this time of year but severe weather may occur in some parts of the warning area.

hazard.text: DAMAGING WINDS and HEAVY RAIN which may lead to FLASH FLOODING
